verses.verse: Now these are the judgments<WH4941> which thou shalt set<WH7760> before<WH6440> them.
If thou buy<WH7069> an Hebrew<WH5680> servant<WH5650>, six<WH8337> years<WH8141> he shall serve<WH5647>: and in the seventh<WH7637> he shall go out<WH3318> free<WH2670> for nothing<WH2600>.
If he came in<WH935> by himself<WH1610>, he shall go out<WH3318> by himself<WH1610>: if he were married<WH1167><WH802>, then his wife<WH802> shall go out<WH3318> with him.

If his master<WH113> have given<WH5414> him a wife<WH802>, and she have born<WH3205> him sons<WH1121> or daughters<WH1323>; the wife<WH802> and her children<WH3206> shall be her master's<WH113>, and he shall go out<WH3318> by himself<WH1610>.
And if the servant<WH5650> shall plainly<WH559> say<WH559>, I love<WH157> my master<WH113>, my wife<WH802>, and my children<WH1121>; I will not go out<WH3318> free<WH2670>:

Then his master<WH113> shall bring<WH5066> him unto the judges<WH430>; he shall also bring<WH5066> him to the door<WH1817>, or unto the door post<WH4201>; and his master<WH113> shall bore<WH7527> his ear<WH241> through with an aul<WH4836>; and he shall serve<WH5647> him for ever<WH5769>.
¶ And if a man<WH376> sell<WH4376> his daughter<WH1323> to be a maidservant<WH519>, she shall not go out<WH3318> as the menservants<WH5650> do<WH3318>.

If she please<WH7451><WH5869> not her master<WH113>, who hath betrothed<WH3259> her to himself, then shall he let her be redeemed<WH6299>: to sell<WH4376> her unto a strange<WH5237> nation<WH5971> he shall have no power<WH4910>, seeing he hath dealt deceitfully<WH898> with her.
And if he have betrothed<WH3259> her unto his son<WH1121>, he shall deal<WH6213> with her after the manner<WH4941> of daughters<WH1323>.
If he take<WH3947> him another<WH312> wife; her food<WH7607>, her raiment<WH3682>, and her duty of marriage<WH5772>, shall he not diminish<WH1639>.
And if he do<WH6213> not these three<WH7969> unto her, then shall she go out<WH3318> free<WH2600> without money<WH3701>.
¶ He that smiteth<WH5221> a man<WH376>, so that he die<WH4191>, shall be surely<WH4191> put to death<WH4191>.
And if a man lie not in wait<WH6658>, but God<WH430> deliver<WH579> him into his hand<WH3027>; then I will appoint<WH7760> thee a place<WH4725> whither he shall flee<WH5127>.
But if a man<WH376> come presumptuously<WH2102> upon his neighbour<WH7453>, to slay<WH2026> him with guile<WH6195>; thou shalt take<WH3947> him from mine altar<WH4196>, that he may die<WH4191>.
¶ And he that smiteth<WH5221> his father<WH1>, or his mother<WH517>, shall be surely<WH4191> put to death<WH4191>.
¶ And he that stealeth<WH1589> a man<WH376>, and selleth<WH4376> him, or if he be found<WH4672> in his hand<WH3027>, he shall surely<WH4191> be put to death<WH4191>.
¶ And he that curseth<WH7043> his father<WH1>, or his mother<WH517>, shall surely<WH4191> be put to death<WH4191>.

¶ And if men<WH582> strive<WH7378> together, and one<WH376> smite<WH5221> another<WH7453> with a stone<WH68>, or<WH176> with his fist<WH106>, and he die<WH4191> not, but keepeth<WH5307> his bed<WH4904>:

If he rise again<WH6965>, and walk<WH1980> abroad<WH2351> upon his staff<WH4938>, then shall he that smote<WH5221> him be quit<WH5352>: only he shall pay<WH5414> for the loss of his time<WH7674>, and shall cause him to be thoroughly<WH7495> healed<WH7495>.
¶ And if a man<WH376> smite<WH5221> his servant<WH5650>, or his maid<WH519>, with a rod<WH7626>, and he die<WH4191> under his hand<WH3027>; he shall be surely<WH5358> punished<WH5358>.
Notwithstanding<WH389>, if he continue<WH5975> a day<WH3117> or two<WH8147>, he shall not be punished<WH5358>: for he is his money<WH3701>.

¶ If men<WH582> strive<WH5327>, and hurt<WH5062> a woman<WH802> with child<WH2030>, so that her fruit<WH3206> depart<WH3318> from her, and yet no mischief follow<WH611>: he shall be surely<WH6064> punished<WH6064>, according as the woman's<WH802> husband<WH1167> will lay<WH7896> upon him; and he shall pay<WH5414> as the judges<WH6414> determine.
And if any mischief follow<WH611>, then thou shalt give<WH5414> life<WH5315> for life<WH5315>,
Eye<WH5869> for eye<WH5869>, tooth<WH8127> for tooth<WH8127>, hand<WH3027> for hand<WH3027>, foot<WH7272> for foot<WH7272>,
Burning<WH3555> for burning<WH3555>, wound<WH6482> for wound<WH6482>, stripe<WH2250> for stripe<WH2250>.

¶ And if a man<WH376> smite<WH5221> the eye<WH5869> of his servant<WH5650>, or the eye<WH5869> of his maid<WH519>, that it perish<WH7843>; he shall let him go<WH7971> free<WH2670> for<WH8478> his eye's<WH5869> sake.
And if he smite<WH5307> out his manservant's<WH5650> tooth<WH8127>, or his maidservant's<WH519> tooth<WH8127>; he shall let him go<WH7971> free<WH2670> for his tooth's<WH8127> sake.

¶ If an ox<WH7794> gore<WH5055> a man<WH376> or a woman<WH802>, that they die<WH4191>: then the ox<WH7794> shall be surely<WH5619> stoned<WH5619>, and his flesh<WH1320> shall not be eaten<WH398>; but the owner<WH1167> of the ox<WH7794> shall be quit<WH5355>.

But if the ox<WH7794> were wont to push with his horn<WH5056> in time past<WH8543><WH8032>, and it hath been testified<WH5749> to his owner<WH1167>, and he hath not kept<WH8104> him in, but that he hath killed<WH4191> a man<WH376> or a woman<WH802>; the ox<WH7794> shall be stoned<WH5619>, and his owner<WH1167> also shall be put to death<WH4191>.
If there be laid<WH7896> on him a sum of money<WH3724>, then he shall give<WH5414> for the ransom<WH6306> of his life<WH5315> whatsoever is laid<WH7896> upon him.
Whether he have gored<WH5055> a son<WH1121>, or<WH176> have gored<WH5055> a daughter<WH1323>, according to this judgment<WH4941> shall it be done<WH6213> unto him.

If the ox<WH7794> shall push<WH5055> a manservant<WH5650> or a maidservant<WH519>; he shall give<WH5414> unto their master<WH113> thirty<WH7970> shekels<WH8255> of silver<WH3701>, and the ox<WH7794> shall be stoned<WH5619>.
¶ And if a man<WH376> shall open<WH6605> a pit<WH953>, or if a man<WH376> shall dig<WH3738> a pit<WH953>, and not cover<WH3680> it, and an ox<WH7794> or an ass<WH2543> fall<WH5307> therein;
The owner<WH1167> of the pit<WH953> shall make it good<WH7999>, and give<WH7725> money<WH3701> unto the owner<WH1167> of them; and the dead<WH4191> beast shall be his.

¶ And if one man's<WH376> ox<WH7794> hurt<WH5062> another's<WH7453>, that he die<WH4191>; then they shall sell<WH4376> the live<WH2416> ox<WH7794>, and divide<WH2673> the money<WH3701> of it; and the dead<WH4191> ox also they shall divide<WH2673>.

Or if it be known<WH3045> that the ox<WH7794> hath used to push<WH5056> in time past<WH8543><WH8032>, and his owner<WH1167> hath not kept<WH8104> him in; he shall surely<WH7999> pay<WH7999> ox<WH7794> for ox<WH7794>; and the dead<WH4191> shall be his own.
